ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Skill Increases
ygData.msgSnippet: Money is still an issue with me at level 54.  I tend to give good loot items to friends.  I m sure I could have gotten a mint for the Sword of the Morning I
ygData.messageBody:
Money is still an issue with me at level 54. I tend to give good loot
items to friends. I'm sure I could have gotten a mint for the Sword of the
Morning I looted (was offered such), but a guildmate is a high level
paladin and really wanted the sword. So I gave it to him. Now I'm out
50,000pp, but it doesn't bother me. Given that its 220pp per attempt on
aqualungs and no one wants them, I've pretty much stopped trying to raise
my tinkering skill pass the catapult trivial point. Just don't have that
kind of cash lying around.


At 09:56 AM 11/28/2000 -0500, you wrote:
>In a message dated 11/27/00 5:31:52 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
>jcs0001@... writes:
>
> > yeah, but at what levels does this start happening? i mean cmon.
>
>
>Somewhere around 45 money became a nonissue. I had most that I wanted, the
>rest was loot or trade only or was silly expensive. Highest I have ever seen
>is 8k but I buy things for friends often as well so money never stays long. I
>still stay at 5k or so avg but if I would sell items rather than give them
>away to friends I would alwyas have lots more :)
